column4: here's what I get when I try to run sudo apt-get update .. lots of Err 404's .. http://paste.ubuntu.com/347269/ How do I correct that
it looks like those repos are bad (for now). you either comment them out or ignore the 404's
it happens even after changing the default servers..
you have a lot of repos there. I suggest you just ignore the 404's unless you can't get some specific packages
it's weird that there are so many repos.. here's my sources list.. http://pastebin.com/f52fc95de
r0k3tm3n yea.. restarting doesn't solve much.. I'm just trying to do a apt-get update && apt-get upgrade
the servers are probably down and if that is the case, just let it go
servers in the U.S. , England, and Main?  Tried all three locations.
what is this ubuntu-rocks.org thing?
I had synaptic search for the fastest server to my location.. that's what it chose.
ok, but is there a package you cannot install because of these errors?
.. not sure.. haven't tried..
you have far more than enough repos

you'd think.. it looks like the intrepid -updates, -main, -restricted... are the ones giving issues.. those should always be active.. most of the others are for other packages that I like to keep on top of .. and they seem to be functional
what does ddebs.ubuntu.com repos differ to those of archive.ubuntu-rocks.org?

yea.. I've been looking at those.. I'm not sure where they are coming from.. they appear to be main repos for intrepid but have issues possibly because of the address line containing "binary-i386/Packages.gz" in the address line
what's the difference between a repo beginning with deb http://<address> vs. deb http://*ddebs*.<address line>
it's the first time I see ddebs
maybe I'll just comment them out and see what happens.
looks like it's fixed.. no more errors.. weird
now I'm off to reinstall windows for my son.. that's a two day process with all the updates, drivers, configuration, software install etc.. argggg.
